TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed WebBrowserPermissionLevel extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the permission level for a Web browser.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this enumeration to set the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.WebBrowserPermission.Level%2A> property of the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.WebBrowserPermission> class.
The Safe permission level restricts the following Web browser operations.
- A pop-up window cannot be created over the Web browser control.
- The Web browser control can only be navigated to its site of origin.
- The security settings of the Web browser control are reduced.
## Examples The following example shows how to demand that the calling code has unrestricted permission to create a Web browser control.
[!code-cs[WebBrowserPermissionsSnippets#WebBrowserPermissionAttribute3](~/add/codesnippet/CSharp/WebBrowserPermissionsSnippets/Window1.xaml.cs#webbrowserpermissionattribute3)] [!code-vb[WebBrowserPermissionsSnippets#WebBrowserPermissionAttribute3](~/add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/webbrowserpermissionssnippets/window1.xaml.vb#webbrowserpermissionattribute3)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Permissions.WebBrowserPermissionLevel None = int32(0)

Docs.summary: A Web browser that cannot navigate frames to HTML.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Permissions.WebBrowserPermissionLevel Safe = int32(1)

Docs.summary: A Web browser that can safely navigate frames to HTML but with several restrictions.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Permissions.WebBrowserPermissionLevel Unrestricted = int32(2)

Docs.summary: A Web browser that can navigate without restrictions.
